page.title: 17VILLAGE SURVEY PART 2
page.content: OUT OF A POSSIBLE TOTAL OF 520 ON THE ELECTORAL ROLL WE RECEIVED 151 REPLIES TO A QUESTION ON RELIGION.211 SAID THEY WERE CHURCH OF ENGLAND,40 WERE METHODISTS,10 ROMAN CATHOLICS,2 WERE BUDDHISTS AND 1 EACH WERE CHURCH OF SCOTLAND,SALVATION ARMY OR AGNOSTIC.THE ONLY PLACES OF WORSHIP IN THE VILLAGE ARE THE CHURCH AND THE METHODIST CHAPEL.WE RECEIVED 243 REPLIES TO A QUESTION ON WORK.50% WERE IN FULL-TIME WORK,21% HAD RETIRED,19% WORKED PART-TIME,4% WERE HOUSEWIVES,3% WERE UNEMPLOYED AND 2% WERE IN FULL-TIME EDUCATION.WE FOUND THAT 66% TRAVELLED TO WORK BY CAR,9% WALKED,7% CYCLED,6% WENT BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT(BUS),5% WENT BY VAN,4% BY MOTOR CYCLE AND 1% BY WORKS VEHICLE.TWO PEOPLE WHO WORKED ABROAD USED TRAIN AND AIR.
